result.execSummary:
The defendant Chuck Santell Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation>$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

#8102 - Restitution to IC

Court goes over the Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing form with Def;   Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def waives his right to have preliminary hearing.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings. Information is filed; charges mirror complaint.
Def from PCJ

09:06 AM Defendant Chuck Santell Baker in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore appearing via zoom.  Defendant Chuck Santell Baker in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin appeared via zoom.  Chuck Santell Baker appeared by video means with Attorney. Walker: guilty to charge; 1 year probation: court costs, restitution $7150.00 joint and several with 15CF129 Rebecca Robbins. Atty Larimore agrees; just appointed Tuesday, notes for the record the short time frame. Court addresses the Def as to time frame. Court goes over Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form with Defendant;   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to charge.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicated Def guilty of charge. Atty Walker and Atty Larimore addresses sentencing.  Atty Walker reads letter from victim's son. Court: S/W 1 year probation conditions: $7150.00 restitutiion joint and several with 15CF129 Rebecca Robbins - cash bond to apply, restitution surcharge,  court costs, DNA. 29 days credit if probation is revoked.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 9:39
Waiver of Prelim on July 17, 2020 at 09:00 am.
Joel Larimore

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTACT WITH D.A.C., DOB 03/08/35.
NO CONTACT WITH I.L.B.C.

03:14 PM Defendant Chuck Santell Baker appears via videoconferencing from PCJ w/Atty. Samantha Richie via phone.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared via phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Defendant has copy of Complaint, Defendant waives reading of the Complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  ADA Walker states position as to bond; notes age of case, County incurred $2,500 to transport Defendant, cites history and extradition.  Requests $2,500 cash bond and no contact provisions.  Atty. Richie responds and states Defendant was unaware of warrant.  Court orders bond as requested by State and advises Defendant of additional standard conditions.  Court questions address and directs Defendant to provide entire address to COC.  Court questions DOB (year corrected) and phone.  Non-military.   Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2020 at 10:00 am.
